=Use Cases - Off-Screen Element Model - Items=

For quality assurance, starting from the soon to be release version 1.8.0 of the metalmouth extension, all of the following basic use cases must be able to be completed without issue (on Windows and Mac) before a new version of the metalmouth extension can be considered to be acceptable for public release.   This document is incomplete and will be added to shortly, and updated over time.

----

==B1) OSEM items (on focus) - Non-WAI-ARIA based==

===B1.1) Page header area===

====B1.1.1) No content====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # Space bar has been pressed.
  # The following code should be present in the DOM:
{{{<header></header>}}}

Action(s):
  # Press down arrow until last OSEM has been read.

Expected outcome(s):
   # No OSEM item should have been formed for this empty element.

====B1.1.2) Text content only====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # Space bar has been pressed.
  # The following code should be present in the DOM:
{{{<header>}}}_text only contents_{{{</header>}}}

Action(s):
  # Press down arrow until current OSEM is the defined "page header area".

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth should say "page header area".
  # metalmouth should say "text only contents".

====B1.1.3) Some html content====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # Space bar has been pressed.
  # The following code should be present in the DOM:
{{{<header>}}}_some html contents_{{{</header>}}}

Action(s):
  # Press down arrow until current OSEM is the defined "page header area".

Expected outcome(s):
   # metalmouth should say "page header area".
